snippet: With Russian scientists poised to take some samples from a deep subglacial lake in Antarctica, outlandish theories persist about what may be discovered -- including Hitler's remains.
abstract: With Russian scientists poised to take some samples from a deep subglacial lake in Antarctica, outlandish theories persist about what may be discovered -- including Hitler's remains.
lead_paragraph: As my colleague David M. Herszenhorn reports, scientists are poised to take some highly anticipated samples from a deep subglacial lake in Antarctica, saying on Wednesday that they had succeeded in boring through more than two miles of ice.

headline.main: World War II Rumor About an Ancient Lake Is Revived
